intro: Urostachys myrtuosus, commonly known as the red-flowered pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, red-pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Urostachys myrtuosus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
